title: So quick question
body: Is using R to find which builds do the most damage cheating? If not, is there a way to use the Riot API to do this so I don't have to manually enter in all the data for each item?

replies.body: Using R to find builds? I'm a little confused about what exactly you mean here, but looking up items build from other players is perfectly fine, heck even encouraged sometimes!

R is a programming language used for statistics. I made a script that compares a bunch of different combinations of items and returns the one that does the most damage :v

Soooo is there a way to use the Riot API for this? Like, I'm not selling it or anything, It's entirely for personal use only.

A script you say? [**I think this is the most appropriate response here**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/225266848). Be careful when using any type of third-party program, self-made or not, that could give you some type of edge within the game. I wouldn't say this would give you an edge since you could just look up a build, but our system might detect it as a malicious program.

Well I'd only be using it outside of the game when I'm not playing :v

Sooo what's riots stance on using their API for personal use? <:3c

>
> Well I'd only be using it outside of the game when I'm not playing :v

> Sooo what's riots stance on using their API for personal use? <:3c

Basically they're generally ok with things if it's not giving you some kind of advantage in game, that being said if they do find it to be unfair  somehow they will ban you hard, all this being said it sounds like you're basically just trying to make a program to tell you the most effective builds, and so that's probably not gonna get you in trouble but use at your own risk, so up to you.
